Table of Contents

Interface IRuleEngine

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Services
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Service interface for rule evaluation engine that processes articles against defined rules and conditions. Provides comprehensive rule evaluation with support for complex condition groups and validation.

public interface IRuleEngine

Remarks

This service centralizes rule evaluation logic with the following capabilities:

  • Evaluation of individual conditions against article properties
  • Evaluation of condition groups with logical operators (AND/OR)
  • Validation of condition syntax and semantic correctness
  • Support for various condition types (title, content, author, date, etc.)

All methods use DTOs to maintain separation of concerns.

Methods

EvaluateBatchAsync(List<int>, int, CancellationToken)

Evaluates multiple articles against a rule in batch.

Task<Dictionary<int, bool>> EvaluateBatchAsync(List<int> articleIds, int ruleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

articleIds List<int>

The list of article IDs to evaluate.

ruleId int

The ID of the rule to evaluate against.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<Dictionary<int, bool>>

A dictionary mapping article IDs to evaluation results.

Exceptions

ArgumentNullException

Thrown if articleIds is null.

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if ruleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

EvaluateConditionAsync(int, int, CancellationToken)

Evaluates a single condition against an article to determine if it matches.

Task<bool> EvaluateConditionAsync(int articleId, int conditionId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

articleId int

The ID of the article to evaluate against the condition.

conditionId int

The ID of the condition to evaluate.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the article satisfies the condition; otherwise, false.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if articleId or conditionId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

EvaluateConditionGroupAsync(int, int, LogicalOperator, CancellationToken)

Evaluates a group of conditions against an article using the specified logical operator.

Task<bool> EvaluateConditionGroupAsync(int articleId, int ruleId, LogicalOperator logicalOperator = LogicalOperator.AND, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

articleId int

The ID of the article to evaluate against the conditions.

ruleId int

The ID of the rule containing the conditions.

logicalOperator LogicalOperator

The logical operator to apply (AND or OR). Default: AND.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the condition group evaluates to true; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Evaluation behavior:

  • For AND operator: Returns true only if ALL conditions evaluate to true
  • For OR operator: Returns true if ANY condition evaluates to true
Short-circuit evaluation is applied for performance.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if articleId or ruleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

TestConditionWithTextAsync(int, string, CancellationToken)

Tests a condition against sample text without requiring an article.

Task<bool> TestConditionWithTextAsync(int conditionId, string sampleText, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

conditionId int

The ID of the condition to test.

sampleText string

The sample text to test against.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the sample text satisfies the condition; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Useful for testing conditions in the rule editor without fetching real articles.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if conditionId is less than or equal to 0.

ArgumentException

Thrown if sampleText is null.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

ValidateConditionAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Validates that a condition is properly formed and contains all required properties.

Task<bool> ValidateConditionAsync(int conditionId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

conditionId int

The ID of the condition to validate.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<bool>

True if the condition is valid; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Validation checks include:

  • For regex conditions: regex pattern is valid and compiles
  • Required values are present for the operator type
  • GroupId and Order are non-negative

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if conditionId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.

ValidateRuleConditionsAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Validates all conditions for a rule.

Task<RuleValidationResultDto> ValidateRuleConditionsAsync(int ruleId, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

ruleId int

The ID of the rule whose conditions to validate.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

A CancellationToken to observe while waiting for the task to complete.

Returns

Task<RuleValidationResultDto>

A validation result containing success flag and any validation errors.

Exceptions

ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if ruleId is less than or equal to 0.

OperationCanceledException

Thrown if the operation is canceled via the cancellation token.
